location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 3539 of 1866 from Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Bombay to the Political Resident Persian Gulf and the Accountant General, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing translations of two letters from Sayed Torkee [Turki bin Said] outlining his intentions to attack Muskat [Muscat] again and requesting financial aid as well as informing the British Government of requests from other tribes to be allowed to assist him by sea. Pelly goes on to request instructions on the course to pursue with regards to these matters.Enclosures not included.
